items.title: Rent for Millions of New Yorkers Could Increase by 2 to 5 Percent
items.abstract: The panel, known as the Rent Guidelines Board, took a preliminary vote on potential rent hikes on Tuesday evening.

items.title: All of New York City falls under the C.D.C. guidelines for indoor masking.
items.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio said those who got vaccinated at a city-run site starting Friday would receive $100, as officials weighed whether to bring back a mask mandate.
keywords: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

items.title: Covid and N.Y.C. Schools: Back to Class, and Finally Back to Normal?
items.abstract: The city Education Department has ended most Covid restrictions for students, although teachers still have to be vaccinated.

items.title: New York City tells health providers to give booster shots to all adults who want them.
items.abstract: City officials asked health providers not to turn adults away, provided they met timing requirements, a move that comes as federal regulators consider expanding the eligibility pool for Pfizer-BioNTech’s booster.

items.title: City’s Rent Board Approves Increases of 1.5% and 2.5%
items.abstract: One-year leases on rent-stabilized units can climb 1.5 percent, and two-year leases can increase 2.5 percent, the Rent Guidelines Board decided in a 5-to-4 vote on Tuesday night.
